page.title: 02LANDSCAPE WEST MOORS
page.content: The road from{Ferndown}to{West Moors, runs between a country setting of trees, fields and widely-spaced homes. People worry that the new{bypass}will destroy the countryside, and yet it is needed badly because it will take heavy through traffic out of Ferndown. When you approach the village of West Moors, you see several shops which include newsagent, chemist, wool shop, baker, bank, grocer and also a large DIY centre. These cater for the needs of the population which is mainly elderly. Over the years West Moors has grown considerably from a village to a town. There is a social club, playing field, bowling green, several pubs and a nearby library. Several of our teachers have their homes in West Moors and find it a pleasant place to live.
